quest.name: First Run
quest.synopsis: You're a fresh courier in The Hollows with nothing but desperation and a busted vehicle. Dispatcher Chen sizes you up, decides you might last a week, and gives you a simple delivery: medical supplies to the Night Market. It's supposed to be routine. But in this city, nothing ever is.
quest.description: This tutorial introduces core mechanics: navigation, package handling, time pressure, basic driving, and the rating system. The player learns that every delivery matters—your reputation is your survival.

primary.description: Deliver medical supplies to Dr. Tanaka's clinic in the Night Market

secondary.description: Meet Rosa at the station garage

optional.description: Explore The Hollows - find 2 street landmarks
Talk to Chen about courier life

act1_setup.hook: You're broke, desperate, and out of options. The courier gig is the last chance before the streets swallow you.
act1_setup.context: The Hollows Courier Station is a lifeline for people like you—bottom-tier, unaugmented, hungry. Dispatcher Chen has seen a thousand rookies come through. Most don't make it. But he gives everyone a chance.

act2_complication.setup: The drive to Night Market is straightforward. Tutorial tooltips explain navigation, HUD elements, package handling. Rosa fixed your vehicle—it runs, barely. The route takes you through safe zones.
act2_complication.twist: Halfway to the destination, you witness a corporate recovery team extracting a crashed courier from a wreck. The courier is screaming. Heavy chrome, barely human, being hauled away like property.
act2_complication.chenComms: Don't stop. Keep moving. That's what happens when you miss too many deliveries.
act2_complication.moralWeight: This moment establishes the tone—this world is cruel, and you're one missed delivery from that fate.

act3_resolution.climax: You arrive at Dr. Tanaka's clinic (a gray-market medical facility in Night Market). She's professional, grateful, pays immediately.
act3_resolution.tanakaWarning: Chrome is a trap. It feels like power, but it's a leash. Be careful how much you take.
act3_resolution.firstRating: Not bad for a rookie. Client was satisfied. You got a 4.2 star rating. Keep that up, you'll make Tier 1 in a week. Drop below 3 stars, and you're done.

branchingPaths.name: Efficient Professional
branchingPaths.trigger: Deliver on time, package intact, didn't stop for complication

branchingPaths.name: Empathetic Observer
branchingPaths.trigger: Stopped to watch the corpo extraction, asked Chen about it afterwards

consequences.chenReaction: Empathy gets you killed in this job.

branchingPaths.name: Scared Survivor
branchingPaths.trigger: Sped away from extraction scene, delivered early but shaken

consequences.chenReaction: You'll get used to it. Or you'll quit.

complications.resolution: Pull over briefly, let engine cool
complications.failureConsequence: If ignored, vehicle breaks down (teaches failure states)

complications.description: Street vendor flags you down, offers discount food
complications.resolution: Can buy (teaches economy) or ignore (teaches time pressure)

shortTerm.immediateImpact: You're now a courier. The city's rating system owns you.
shortTerm.economicReality: 150 credits isn't much. You'll need many more runs to survive.
shortTerm.socialIntegration: The Hollows Station becomes your home base.

longTerm.storyRamifications: How you handled the extraction scene affects how NPCs perceive you
longTerm.characterOutcomes: Chen, Rosa, and Tanaka are now part of your world
longTerm.worldStateChanges: You're in the system—the Algorithm knows you exist

items.description: Medical supplies for Dr. Tanaka's clinic

writingNotes.chenVoice: Tired pragmatist, seen it all. Not cruel, but not soft.
writingNotes.rosaVoice: Warm, competent, friendly. Wants you to succeed.
writingNotes.tanakaVoice: Professional, clinical, but humane. Early warning about chrome.

playerTakeaway: This world is cruel and exploitative
The rating system is life or death
Chrome is everywhere, and you'll need it eventually
There are good people trying to help you survive
Failure looks like that screaming courier
You're in the system now—there's no going back
centralQuestion: How far will you go to stay alive? What will you trade?
